newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singaporean jailed in "road rage" case.
newsitem.headline: Singaporean jailed in "road rage" case.

text.p: A Singaporean who put a truck driver into a coma for five days after hitting him for blocking the road has been jailed for nine months, The New Paper reported on Wednesday.
It said Ng Heng Kang's truck was blocking the road when Tan Chin Seng, 42, pulled up behind and started cursing. It said Tan later hit driver with a long piece of wood.
"I didn't seen him coming. It was so quick. Suddenly something hit me on the head, 'pong, pong,pong'," Ng, 40, told the evening newspaper.
Ng said he was unconscious with a fractured skull for five days following the October attack.
Tan faced a maximum sentence of seven years in jail and could have been fined or caned.
